required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Yogurt for Prevention of Chronic Inflammation
clinical_study.official_title: Anti-inflammatory Activity of Yogurt Mediated by the Intestine

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to conduct a randomized cross-over dietary intervention in obese adult women to compare how yogurt and a control food affect biomarkers of inflammation and intestinal health.

primary_outcome.description: Change in proportions of circulating Th17 cells (change in control vs. change in yogurt)

secondary_outcome.description: Change in proportion of circulating Treg cells (change in control vs. change in yogurt)
Change in proportion of circulating Treg subpopulation (FoxP3+ IL-10+) (change in control vs. change in yogurt)
Change in proportion of circulating Th17 subpopulation (IL-17A+ TNFα+) (change in control vs. change in yogurt)
Change in proportion of circulating Th17 subpopulation (IL-17A+ IFNδ+) (change in control vs. change in yogurt)
Change in proportion of circulating Th17 subpopulation (IL-17A+ IL-22+) (change in control vs. change in yogurt)
Change in proportion of circulating Th17 subpopulation (IL-17A+ FoxP3+) (change in control vs. change in yogurt)
Change in proportion of circulating Th17 subpopulation (IL-17A+ IL-10+) (change in control vs. change in yogurt)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in plasma tumor necrosis factor alpha (TNF-alpha)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in fasting plasma TNF-alpha (change in control vs. change in yogurt)
Change in fasting plasma IFN-gamma (change in control vs. change in yogurt)
Change in fasting plasma IL-6 (change in control vs. change in yogurt)
Change in fasting plasma IL-17A (change in control vs. change in yogurt)
Change in fasting plasma IL-4 (change in control vs. change in yogurt)
Change in fasting plasma IL-22 (change in control vs. change in yogurt)
Change in fasting plasma IL-10 (change in control vs. change in yogurt)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in plasma transforming growth factor beta (TGF-beta)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in fasting plasma TGF-beta (change in control vs. change in yogurt)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in retinoic acid receptor-related orphan nuclear receptor gamma T (RORgammaT) expression
secondary_outcome.description: Change in fasting plasma RORgammaT expression (change in control vs. change in yogurt)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Forkhead box P3 (FoxP3) expression
secondary_outcome.description: Change in fasting FoxP3 expression (change in control vs. change in yogurt)
Change in fecal calprotectin (change in control vs. change in yogurt)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in fecal tumor necrosis factor alpha (TNF-alpha)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in fecal TNF-alpha (change in control vs. change in yogurt)
Change in fecal IL-1alpha (change in control vs. change in yogurt)
Change in fecal IL-1beta (change in control vs. change in yogurt)
Change in fecal IL-6 (change in control vs. change in yogurt)
Change in fecal IL-17A (change in control vs. change in yogurt)

other_outcome.description: Change in resting systolic blood pressure (change in control vs. change in yogurt)
Change in resting diastolic blood pressure (change in control vs. change in yogurt)
Body mass index (change in control vs. change in yogurt)
Change in body weight (change in control vs. change in yogurt)
Change in waist circumference (change in control vs. change in yogurt)

other_outcome.measure: Compliance: Number of lids and Unused Containers
other_outcome.description: Number of lids and unused containers of intervention foods (control vs. yogurt)

other_outcome.time_frame: 2 Weeks Prior to Intervention, Weeks 0-4, Weeks 4-8, Weeks 8-12
other_outcome.description: Comparison of dietary records (control vs. yogurt)
Change in gut microbiota beta diversity (change in control vs. change in yogurt)

other_outcome.measure: Change in fecal water ex vivo barrier disrupting activity
other_outcome.description: Change in barrier disrupting activity of fecal water applied to cultured Caco-2 cells (change in control vs. change in yogurt)

other_outcome.measure: Change in fecal total organic carbon
other_outcome.description: Change in total organic carbon (change in control vs. change in yogurt)
Change in fecal butyrate (change in control vs. change in yogurt)
Change in fecal propionate (change in control vs. change in yogurt)
Change in fecal acetate (change in control vs. change in yogurt)

other_outcome.measure: Change in fecal bile acid (deoxycholic acid)
other_outcome.description: Change in fecal deoxycholic acid (change in control vs. change in yogurt)

other_outcome.measure: Change in fecal bile acid (lithocholic acid)
other_outcome.description: Change in fecal lithocholic acid (change in control vs. change in yogurt)

other_outcome.measure: Change in fecal bile acid (hyodeoxycholic acid)
other_outcome.description: Change in fecal hyodeoxycholic acid (change in control vs. change in yogurt)

other_outcome.measure: Change in fecal bile acid (3β,12α-Dihydroxy-5β-cholan-24-oic acid)
other_outcome.description: Change in fecal 3β,12α-Dihydroxy-5β-cholan-24-oic acid (change in control vs. change in yogurt)

arm_group.description: Consumption of 12 oz. of low-fat yogurt daily (2 x 6 oz. servings) for 4 weeks, followed by a washout phase for 4 weeks, then consumption of 12 oz. control food (flavored soy pudding, 2 x 6 oz. servings) for 4 weeks.
Consumption of control food (flavored soy pudding, 2 x 6 oz. servings), followed by a washout phase for 4 weeks, then consumption of 12 oz. of low-fat yogurt daily (2 x 6 oz. servings) for 4 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy premenopausal women age 21-55
- BMI 30 to 40 kg/m2
- not taking medication to control hypertension (e.g. anti-hypertensives or diuretics)
- resting blood pressure <140/90 mmHg
- stable body weight for past two months
- willing to maintain a normal exercise level (in general)
- willing to avoid exercise and smoking (or other forms of nicotine intake) for 24 h prior to blood collection
- willing to avoid caffeine for 12 h before study visits
- willing to fast 12 h prior to study visits
- willing to avoid dietary supplements, yogurt and probiotic-containing foods (as necessary) and consume 12 oz. of yogurt and the control food per day (as necessary) for the duration of the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- self-reported previous diagnoses of an inflammatory disease (e.g. inflammatory bowel disease, asthma, arthritis), CVD, diabetes, current cancer treatment (i.e., chemotherapy, radiation therapy)
- have used oral antibiotics in the prior 21 days before sample collection
- actively trying to lose weight
- regularly taking anti-inflammatory drugs
- vegetarian or allergic to soy or dairy
- are pregnant, lactating, or trying to become pregnant

facility.name: Department of Food Science, Babcock Hall
